file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 25-60-07-04 - ESCAPE ROPE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL ESCAPE ROPE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the escape ropes. B. The escape ropes are installed in the cockpit, at zones 225 and 226. C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 25-60-07-000-801-A ESCAPE ROPE - REMOVAL ALL 25-60-07-400-801-A ESCAPE ROPE - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 25-60-07 Page 1 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 25-60-07-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. ESCAPE ROPE - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to remove the escape ropes. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-03/100 - COMPONENT LOCATION C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 225 225BLC Cockpit LH 226 226BRC Cockpit RH D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Cockpit RH/Cockpit LH I. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) NOTE: Do the same procedures to remove the escape ropes on the LH and RH sides of the cockpit. Open the access panels 225BLC and/or the 226BRC to get the access to the escape ropes ( AMM MPP 06-41-03/100). (2) Remove the bolt (1), washer (2) and bushing (4) that attach the escape rope (3). (3) Remove the escape rope (3). (4) Close the access panels 225BLC and/or the 226BRC ( AMM MPP 06-41-03/100). AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Escape Rope - Removal/Installation Figure 401 - Sheet 2 A ACCESS PANEL A ZONE 1 ZONE 225 226 2 3 4 5 145AMM252600.MCE EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 25-60-07 Page 4 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 25-60-07-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. ESCAPE ROPE - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to install the Escape Rope. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-03/100 - COMPONENT LOCATION C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 225 225BLC Cockpit LH 226 226BRC Cockpit RH D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Cockpit RH/Cockpit LH I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) NOTE: Do the same procedures to install the escape ropes on the LH and RH sides of the cockpit. Open the access panels 225BLC and/or the 226BRC to get the access to the escape ropes ( AMM MPP 06-41-03/100). (2) Tighten the bolt (1), washer (2) and bushing (4) that attach the escape rope (3). (3) Arrange the escape rope as shown in steps 1 thru 4. Keep it in the cockpit housing as shown in step 5. (4) Close the access panels 225BLC and/or the 226BRC ( AMM MPP 06-41-03/100).
